intro: Dombeya ambongensis, commonly known as the mountain dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and can become branched. Dombeya ambongensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
